Issues.Title: build(language-service): remove typescript from ivy bundle
Issues.Body:
Currently the Ivy language service bundle is [10MB](
https://unpkg.com/browse/@angular/language-service@10.0.4/bundles/) because we

Issues.Title: Arrow-style ngOnDestroy not called
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I'm looking for feedback on this issue as much as reporting a potential bug. If ngOnDestroy is called like this: `ngOnDestroy() { [some code] }` Then it works as expected. If ngOnDestroy is called like this: `ngOnDestroy = () => [some code]` Then it is not called. Note that the Typescript linter is actually okay with either style, even though the interface uses: `ngOnDestroy(): void` If you're like me, you would assume that an arrow style function can be used for a lifecycle hook without actually trying it. The issue would be undetectable until you notice that the hook isn't working. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/whynoarrowstyle Two components meet in the woods, one using an arrow style function, and one not using that function type. Click 'Destroy the below'. Notice that the code written in ngOnDestroy is called for the funcStyleComponent, but not the arrowStyleComponent. ## üî• Exception or Error No error, more just looking for an explanation of the existing behavior, and whether more can be done to make it clear that using arrow style functions as lifecycle hooks will be invisibly undetectable. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


     _                      _                 ____ _     ___ 
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 9.1.7
Node: 12.13.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.901.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.7
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.7
@angular/cli                      9.1.7
@angular/fire                     6.0.0
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.7
@schematics/angular               9.1.7
@schematics/update                0.901.7
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.8.3
webpack                           4.42.0
**Anything else relevant?** ngOnDestroy is often used to unsubscribe, and its code can often be reduced to one line. If lifecycle hooks were expressible as arrow style functions, then we could express it in one line, like so: `ngOnDestroy = () => this.subscriptions.unsubscribe();` (Granted, you can say the same thing using classic functions as `ngOnDestroy() { this.subscriptions.unsubscribe; }`, but formatters love to break that into multiple lines.)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Arrow-style ngOnDestroy not called" (#38087)

Issues.Title: build(language-service): Remove ls_rollup_bundle
Issues.Body:
`ls_rollup_bundle` is no longer needed since we could invoke `ng_rollup_bundle` directly.

Background: language service runs rollup to produce a single file to reduce
startup time in the editor. However, due to the need to load dynamic versions
of typescript at runtime (think the case where users can change typescript
version in their editor), we hack the "banner" to export a CommonJS default function,
so that we could dynamically load the typescript module provided at runtime 
by tsserver via AMD and use it throughout the implementation.

Ivy Workspace: Yes

------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.1000.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.1000.2

@schematics/update                 0.1000.2
ng-packagr                         10.0.1
rxjs                               6.6.0
typescript                         3.9.6
webpack                            4.43.0



### Description

I've noticed that if you have a lazy load module with guards that are included inside that lazy load module, the whole module is included in the main chunk, instead of just importing the guard service or lazy load that guard.

ie:

```
{
          path: 'some-lazy-module',
          canActivate: [CanActivateSomeLazyModuleService],
          canDeactivate: [CanDeactivateSomeLazyModuleService],
          loadChildren: () => import('../some/lazy/lazy.module').then(m => m.SomeLazyModule)
}
```

We need to make sure that some services are configured and strategies are set before the module activates and deactivates


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 

Some way of lazy load the guards of the lazy loaded module like the import function

Issues.Title: i18n: check duplicate messages
Issues.Body:
Previously, the i18n message extractor just quietly ignored messages that
it extracted that had the same id. It can be helpful to identify these
to track down messages that have the same id but different message text.

Now the messages are checked for duplicate ids with different message text.
Any that are found can be reported based on the new `--duplicateMessage`
command line option (or `duplicateMessage` API options property).

* "ignore" - no action is taken
* "warning" - a diagnostic warning is written to the logger
* "error" - the extractor throws an error and exits

Fixes #38077
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "i18n: check duplicate messages" (#38082)

Issues.Title: refactor(dev-infra): allow use-case and confusing types to be marked as triaged
Issues.Body:
Some issue reports don't really fall into any of the current buckets that count
towards triage level 2: bug/fix, feature, or refactor. Some reports are:
* working as intended but confusing - the labels might be 'type: confusing', 'comp: docs', 'comp: router'
* generally working as originally designed but a use-case could be argued for a different implementation.
 This type of report is a little hard to triage; it may be neither a bug, nor feature but more of a
 'type: use-case'. These may eventually turn into a bug/fix or feature, but can't necessarily be
 put in those buckets immediately.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(dev-infra): allow use-case and confusing types to be marked as triaged" (#38081)

Issues.Title: framework level support to reuse static parts of ssr
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

I already have something running, but without first level framework support, it introduces footguns and boilerplate.

As an example lets use https://angular.io/. Look at the footer:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905328/87570497-0bfbd100-c6c9-11ea-8555-915f5744c827.png)

Thats completely static. It's a waste to 1) ship that again via javascript & 2) render it again via javascript. When it's already right there in the browser (now ignoring that angular.io neither uses ssr, nor works without javascript - but our page does).

What I'd like to have was something like a `static` directive:

```typescript
<footer *static></footer>
```

Now this is what the framework could do:

* the server
  * flag all styles that are created inside `<footer *static>...</footer>` for reuse in the browser
* the compiler
  * throw an error if you do anything dynamic inside - like adding an event listener
  * create a dynamic component of the insides and put that into a seperate chunk, that is only loaded, when ssr is missing. Of course I could create an NgModule and bootstrap that via ngComponentOutlet. But it would be so much nicer, if the framework would handle that
* the browser
  * pick the ssr styles
  * pick the ssr DOM
  * if ssr is missing, load the contents async and render it

--

I mean, if you use ssr, you already optimize the page to work without javascript. And most of our page does. We intentionally use urls instead of click handler most of the time. Or hidden radio buttons for accordions and checkboxes for switches. We could use event bubbling to bind click handler on a static container to support pushState navigation on static content.

With native support with something like above we could stencil out huge chunks of the page.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "framework level support to reuse static parts of ssr" (#38078)

Issues.Title: add an option for xi18n tool to detect Inconsistency for ID content
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [x ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
With angular i18n, If the same message ID is used in several different places in the source code , but contains different messages, the extracted.xlf contains only one occurence of the ID, one source message (the first one found in sources) and the different locations where the message have been found.

But sometimes during developement process, for different reasons (copy/paste, modification of the message in one source and not in others, etc ....) the same ID, does not contain the same message, and it generates bugs because the messsage will be replace by the only one translation.

In one angular application the same i18n ID used in different places MUST refer the same message. If not, it means there is a problem to be fixed.

example:
`<button mat-menu-itemi18n="@@MY_TEXT_LABEL"(click)="openAuthenticationConfigurationModal()">
  The first Text
</button>
`
 
and somewhere else in the code
`<app-readonly-field i18n-label="@@MY_TEXT_LABEL" label="Another Text">{{getLabelFor()}}</app-readonly-field>`

### Describe the solution you'd like
To avoid this problem, it would be nice to have an option for xi18n tool to detect if a message ID , used several times, refers the same message or not.

something like :
--checkIdContentConsistency
--checkIdSourceConsistency

The xi18n tool has all information to do this check easily



### Describe alternatives you've considered
I've thought to develop some scripts to do, but no easy to implement a angular code parser to extract all messages from code

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: support autocompletion within templates
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked on TemplateTypeChecker implementation of required operations.

Objective 4 for the Ivy LS project is to support autocompletion within templates and template expressions. This is significantly more challenging than the other objectives as it requires processing of "incomplete" expressions within the template, as well as interpretation of cursor positions within those expressions. Additionally, the existing type check block format may not be sufficient for such completion operations, and will likely require augmentation.

There are several kinds of autocompletion operations that need to be supported:

* completing a top-level identifier (which is a reference to a complex namespace involving local template variables as well as component properties)
* completing an element name or attribute
* completing within an expression

It's also unclear from a design standpoint how the responsibility should be split between the compiler and LS codebases for this feature.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: support autocompletion within templates" (#38067)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: support go to definition on symbols within a template
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked on TemplateTypeChecker implementation of required information.

Objective 3 for the Ivy LS project is to support go-to-definition on expressions and symbols within a template, using information derived from the compiler's `TemplateTypeChecker`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: support go to definition on symbols within a template" (#38066)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: show hover tooltip on expressions, bindings, and other nodes within a template
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked on `TemplateTypeChecker` implementation of required information.

Objective 2 for the Ivy LS project is to show hover tooltips on nodes within the template, using information derived from the compiler's `TemplateTypeChecker`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: show hover tooltip on expressions, bindings, and other nodes within a template" (#38065)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: Get `ts.Symbol` from `AST` nodes in a template.
Issues.Body: Add `TemplateTypeChecker` operations to retrieve the `ts.Symbol` of an `AST` expression from a template. Some creative interpretation might be required to determine what constitutes the symbol of various kinds of expressions. Not all expressions will have symbols (e.g. there is no symbol associated with the expression `a + b`, but there are symbols for both the `a` and `b` nodes individually).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: Get `ts.Symbol` from `AST` nodes in a template." (#38064)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: `TemplateTypeChecker` operation to get `ts.Symbol` for input
Issues.Body: Add a `TemplateTypeChecker` operation to retrieve a `ts.Symbol` given a pointer to an input binding within the template AST. This can potentially be resolved without referring to the TCB.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: `TemplateTypeChecker` operation to get `ts.Symbol` for input" (#38063)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: rapid diagnostics for external template changes
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked by #38059, #38058, #38060

Objective 1 for the Ivy LS project is to show template type-checking diagnostics as the user edits a template. Building on the work to build a low latency update mechanism for template diagnostics, and integrate the template type-checking engine with the language service model for `ts.Program` updates, we should be able to implement near-realtime `ts.Diagnostic`s as users edit external templates.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: rapid diagnostics for external template changes" (#38061)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: implement a `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` for the language service
Issues.Body:
The compiler exposes a `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` interface that abstracts how the template type-checking engine can obtain a `ts.Program` with updated template type-checking code. The implementation utilized by `ngc` uses an incremental `ts.Program` creation operation, which is suitable for the command-line compiler and `ng.Program` API, but not for the language service.

The language service has its own mechanisms for creating and updating `ts.Program`s, and thus needs its own implementation of a program strategy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: implement a `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` for the language service" (#38060)

Issues.Title: [9.1.x] test: move app-shell tests to flake jail
Issues.Body:
App-shell builder imports zone.js, which patches the global promises. In some cases this will causes flakiness in tests that run after this one.

With this change we move the app-shell tests to the flake jail and force them to be run at the very last.

Successful runs when disabling app-shell tests from test-large
https://circleci.com/workflow-run/4afb40f2-19ec-46ab-bb94-4153d448e6ad

(cherry picked from commit 7cb470f32ea6fffdb8915a2948abb355101e927f)

Issues.Title: A library is packaged in a way a service part of the injected module in a library is added after the module.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? No it was fine in the past. It was fine with Angular 7 and 8. This is happening since updating to Angular 9. ### Description Getting: Cannot access 'someService' before initialization error when I the updated library. I went and checked the build file and I am able to get it running with no issue when I moved the service anywhere before the module that is injected to. I moved around the order of the services since it was only affecting the providers. Once I re-build the library it's another provider that gets added at the end of the package file. # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Essentially https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/15468 but when it's built and served twice. Not entirely certain this is an Angular CLI issue or something else. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` ng new lazy-loading-dl --routing cd lazy-loading-dl ng g m foo --module app.module --route foo ``` Add the below in app.component.html ``` link to foo ``` Modify .browserslistrc to: ``` IE 9-10 # Angular support for IE 9-10 has been deprecated and will be removed as of Angular v11. To opt-in, remove the 'not' prefix on this line. IE 11 # Angular supports IE 11 only as an opt-in. To opt-in, remove the 'not' prefix on this line. ``` ``` ng build --prod --subresourceIntegrity http-server dist/lazy-loading-dl ``` Open browser and click on the link It actually works fine now. Issues.Title: Export Schematics util functions and make the available for public
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
- None of the above ones: Schematics

### Description
When authoring an Angular CLI schematics, there are some very common things that will be implemented by almost every schematic new as there are no common public functions available.
A quick [search on NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/search?q=schematic%20utils) leads to many community project results.
However as the Angular CLI itself uses the schematics and common utils, which are already tested and well defined, they should be available for the public.

For example the package [`@ockilson/schematic-utils`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@ockilson/schematics-utils#dependencies) implements the same (or almost the same) functions as already available in the [Angular CLI repo](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/utility/dependencies.ts)

To prevent some common pitfalls such functions and code duplications such common functions should be exported by `@angular-devkit/schematics`.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Export all functions from [packages/schematics/angular/utility](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/tree/master/packages/schematics/angular/utility) to be available for other schematics.
I think they should be exported via `@angular-devkit/schematics` or as `@angular-devkit/schematics/utils`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Export Schematics util functions and make the available for public" (#18250)

Issues.Title: Speed up angular library build
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

`ng build some-lib --watch` will rebuild the whole program every time there is a modification. 
And our library is very large, every time you change a line of ts and save it, it will take a long time to recompile.


### Describe the solution you'd like

I think that when ng build --watch, it is not necessary to perform the operation of packing fesm and umd.
Every time we change a line of css or a line of js, it only updates a single js file of esm2015. Compiling a single file should not take a long time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Speed up angular library build" (#18246)

Issues.Title: bug(overlay): cdk-overlay-container a11y failure (not contained by landmark)
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Visit https://overlay-cont-a11y.stackblitz.io/
2. Open the mat-select so a `cdk-overlay-container` is present
2. Run axe plugin to check 508 (https://www.deque.com/axe/browser-extensions/)

axe gives the following error regarding the `cdk-overlay-container`, since it is outside the `main` landmark:

```
All page content must be contained by landmarks
```

![Screen Shot 2020-07-15 at 8 46 27 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20215564/87617138-63f00300-c6dc-11ea-829d-8420dd8ad013.png)


 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Overlay container should not throw an a11y violation


#### Actual Behavior

See above


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.3
- CDK/Material: 10.0.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  OSX
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(overlay): cdk-overlay-container a11y failure (not contained by landmark)" (#20001)

Issues.Title: bug(Material Checkbox): MAT_CHECKBOX_DEFAULT_OPTIONS doesn't work with [checked] attribute
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz with repro: https://angular-pwkkbn.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open stackblitz
1. CIick on the checkbox or within the div with the green border 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The state of the checkbox should stay in sync with the displayed value of `shouldBeChecked`

#### Actual Behavior

The state of the checkbox never changes. It is always unchecked.

#### Workaround

Can be worked around using the deprecated MAT_CHECKBOX_CLICK_ACTION provider. In checkbox-configurable-example.ts in the linked Stackblitz (https://angular-pwkkbn.stackblitz.io), if you uncomment line 16 and comment out lines 19-22, it behaves properly.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.4
- CDK/Material: 10.0.2
- Browser(s): Chrome, likely others
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Material Checkbox): MAT_CHECKBOX_DEFAULT_OPTIONS doesn't work with [checked] attribute" (#19999)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(CDK:Overlay): Stackblitz example broken
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

**Provide a brief summary of what you would like to see changed in our documentation at material.angular.io.**

I'd like to see the Stackblitz example for the CDK Overly work. 

Feel free to provide any suggestions of content or examples you‚Äôd like us to include.
To reproduce:

1. Go to https://material.angular.io/cdk/overlay/examples
2. Click on the button to "Edit Overlay basic example example in Stackblitz"  (yes, 'example' is duplicated in the html and should be fixed)
3. Stackblitz https://stackblitz.com/angular/ldqanovorkl?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-overlay-basic-example.ts opens in a new tab
4. Stackblitz spinner icon appears messed up, but that is not a problem with the documentation
5. When the spinner goes away, a series of error messages appears.  At the top is:
`Error in /turbo_modules/@angular/compiler@10.0.4/bundles/compiler.umd.js (2921:21)
Template parse errors:
There is no directive with "exportAs" set to "cdkOverlayOrigin" `


**Affected documentation page:** 

https://material.angular.io/cdk/overlay/examples

Tested on Windows 10 Pro, 1803 Build 17134.1550 in browsers:

- Chrome Version 83.0.4103.116 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Firefox 72.0.2 (64-bit)
- Edge Chromium Version 79.0.309.71 (Official build) (64-bit)

Firefox and Edge did not display the messed up spinner on Stackblitz, but had the same error messages.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(CDK:Overlay): Stackblitz example broken" (#19997)

Issues.Title: fix(table): no data row not shown if data source is empty on init
Issues.Body:
There's an early `return` in the function that renders all the rows, including the one that is shown for no data, if there were no changes to the data source. This was preventing the no data row from showing up if the data source starts off as empty.

Fixes #19992.

Issues.Title: bug(Expansion Panel): Expansion Panels aligned in a grid all expand/collapse at the same time
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue-expansion-panels-in-grid

Steps to reproduce:
1. Repeat and populate expansion panels in a container
2. Style the container to align the panels with the grid display in CSS at wide widths
 

#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
That when the panels lie side-by-side in wider screens, expanding or collapsing one panel, only expands or collapses it and does not affect the expansion state of other panels by it.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
When the panels lie side-by-side in wider screens, expanding or collapsing one panel, expands or collapses all other panels that on the same grid row with it.


#### Environment

- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Expansion Panel): Expansion Panels aligned in a grid all expand/collapse at the same time" (#19993)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): not updating calendar state if input changes while open
Issues.Body:
The datepicker was only updating the calendar state that depends on the input when we open and close. I've reworked it so we do it any time one of the input's inputs changes. I also renamed the various `_disabledChange` streams to `_stateChanges` which aligns with what we're doing in other components.

Fixes #19959.
